on greet(name) { println("Hello, " + name + "!") }

greet("World") // Hello, World!

Return Values

function add(a, b) {
    return a + b
}

result = add(3, 4)  // 7

Functions without an explicit return statement return none.

Multiple Parameters

function create_enemy(x, y, health) {
    enemy = {}
    enemy.x = x
    enemy.y = y
    enemy.health = health
    return enemy
}

boss = create_enemy(400, 100, 500)

No Parameters

function get_random_color() {
    r = random_int(0, 255)
    g = random_int(0, 255)
    b = random_int(0, 255)
    return rgb(r, g, b)
}

Early Return

function divide(a, b) {
    if b == 0 {
        println("Error: division by zero")
        return none
    }
    return a / b
}

First-Class Functions

Functions are values. You can store them in variables and pass them around:

function double(x) {
    return x * 2
}

operation = double
result = operation(5)  // 10

Anonymous Functions

Create functions without naming them:

add = function(a, b) {
    return a + b
}

result = add(3, 4)  // 7

Closures

Functions capture variables from their enclosing scope:

function make_counter() {
    count = 0
    return function() {
        count = count + 1
        return count
    }
}

counter = make_counter()
println(counter())  // 1
println(counter())  // 2
println(counter())  // 3

Game Callbacks

Pixel automatically calls these functions if you define them:

function on_start() {
    // Called once when the game starts
    create_window(800, 600, "My Game")
}

function on_update(dt) {
    // Called every frame
    // dt = time since last frame in seconds
    player_x = player_x + speed * dt
}


function on_draw() {
    // Called every frame after on_update
    clear(BLACK)
    draw_sprite(player)
}

Input Callbacks

function on_key_down(key) {
    if key == KEY_SPACE {
        jump()
    }
}

function on_key_up(key) {
    // Key was released
}


function on_mouse_click(button, x, y) {
    if button == MOUSE_LEFT {
        shoot(x, y)
    }
}


function on_mouse_move(x, y) {
    cursor_x = x
    cursor_y = y
}
